oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from Charles Martin Simmons
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Charles Martin Simmons was from Chester County, Tennessee and in this letter he writes of sickness and being quarantined. He writes, "The sickness is still heavy in this camp and also there is a number of Deaths most ever day" (sic). Simmons served in Truck Co. C, 8th Corps Art. Park. The illness he references is probably the influenza pandemic which ravaged the world between 1918 and 1920. This particular flu was particularly harsh on young men and swept through military camps at an astonishing rate.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
